column5: BUSINESSES AND ORGANISATIONS TODAY NEED CREATIVE, MULTIDISCIPLINARY MANAGERS WHO COMBINE TECHNOLOGICAL KNOW-HOW WITH ENGINEERING AND MANAGEMENT SKILLS.Do you see yourself taking on such a role in, for example, production and logistics, healthcare and/or financial engineering? Are you excited about using simulations, mathematical and/or statistical models to solve the problems and improve the performance of (international) organisations? If so, the Master’s in Industrial Engineering & Management (IEM) at the University of Twente might just be the right choice for you.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
